data.name: Maintain an Inventory of Information Systems
data.description: Put together a detailed list of the information systems you use (including date of purchase, upgrades, and repairs) and how they interact with other systems in a network.

tests.title: VM Instance Limit
tests.description: Determines if the number of VM instances is close to the Azure per-region limit
tests.more_info: Azure limits regions to certain numbers of resources. Exceeding those limits could prevent resources from launching.
tests.recommended_action: Contact Azure support to increase the number of instances available

tests.title: VM Availability Set Limit
tests.description: Determine if the number of VM instances is close to the Azure per-availability set limit
tests.more_info: Azure limits availability sets to certain numbers of resources. Exceeding those limits could prevent resources from launching.
tests.recommended_action: Contact Azure support to increase the number of instances available

tests.title: Resources Usage Limits
tests.description: Determines if resources are close to the Azure per-account limit
tests.more_info: Azure limits accounts to certain numbers of resources. Exceeding those limits could prevent resources from launching.
tests.recommended_action: Check if resources are close to the account limit to avoid resource launch failures

data.name: Categorize Information Systems
data.description: Classify these systems according to confidentiality, integrity, and availability, then further stratify them into low, medium, and high risk level to align sensitive data with the appropriate security ranking.

tests.title: High Severity Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that high severity alerts are properly configured.
tests.more_info: Enabling high severity alerts ensures that microsoft alerts for potential security issues are sent and allows for quick mitigation of the associated risks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that high severity alerts are configured to be sent.

data.name: Maintain a System Security Plan
data.description: Under the legislation, organizations must create a system security plan detailing security controls and policies.

tests.title: Monitor Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Disk Encryption monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits disk encryption in all virtual machines to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Disk Encryption from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for virtual machines.

tests.title: Open SMTP
tests.description: Determine if TCP port 25 for SMTP is open to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as SMTP should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 25 to known IP addresses
tests.remediation_description: The impacted network security group rule will be deleted if no input is provided. If the failing port is in a port range and no input is provided, the range will be deleted. Otherwise, any input will replace the open CIDR rule.

tests.title: Open Oracle

tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as Oracle should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP ports 1521 to known IP addresses
tests.remediation_description: The impacted network security group rule will be deleted if no input is provided. If the failing port is in a port range and no input is provided, the range will be deleted. Otherwise, any input will replace the open CIDR rule.

tests.title: Blob Container Private Access
tests.description: Ensures that all blob containers do not have anonymous public access set
tests.more_info: Blob containers set with public access enables anonymous users to read blobs within a publicly accessible container without authentication. All blob containers should have private access configured.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure each blob container is configured to restrict anonymous access
tests.remediation_description: Access level for affected blob containers will be set to private

tests.title: Application Whitelisting Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Security Center Monitor Adaptive Application Whitelisting is enabled
tests.more_info: Adaptive application controls work in conjunction with machine learning to analyze processes running in a VM and help control which applications can run, hardening the VM against malware.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Virtual Machines from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used.

tests.title: Default Security Group
tests.description: Ensures that default security groups block all traffic by default
tests.more_info: The default security group is often used for resources launched without a defined security group. For this reason, the default rules should be set to block all traffic to prevent an accidental exposure.
tests.recommended_action: Update the rules for the default security group to deny all traffic by default

tests.title: Monitor VM Vulnerability
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor Vulnerability Assessment is enabled in Security Center.
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for detected vulnerabilities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure VM Vulnerability monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Encryption is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor for unencrypted SQL databases, associated backups, and transaction log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL encryption monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Auditing
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Auditing is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor SQL databases.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL auditing monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Open All Ports
tests.description: Ensures Network Security Groups do not expose all ports to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, almost all services should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict ports to known IP addresses

tests.title: Log Container Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that the Activity Log Container does not have public read access
tests.more_info: The container used to store Activity Log data should not be exposed publicly to avoid data exposure of sensitive activity logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the access level for the storage account containing Activity Log data is set to private.

tests.title: NSG Log Analytics Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Security Group logs are sent to the Log Analytics workspace
tests.more_info: Enabling Log Analytics for Network Security Groups ensures that logs are shipped to a central repository that can be queried and audited.
tests.recommended_action: Enable sending of logs to Log Analytics for each Network Security Group resource in the Azure Monitor.

tests.title: Security Configuration Monitoring
tests.description: Ensures that Security Configuration Monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for security configurations.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Security Configuration Monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Resources Allowed Locations
tests.description: Ensures deployed resources and resource groups belong to the list set in the allowed locations for resource groups policy
tests.more_info: Setting allowed locations for a service helps ensure the service can only be deployed in expected locations.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all services contain policy definitions that defined allowed locations.

tests.title: Resource Location Matches Resource Group
tests.description: Ensures a policy is configured to audit that deployed resource locations match their resource group locations
tests.more_info: Using Azure Policy to monitor resource location compliance helps ensure that new resources are not launched into locations that do not match their resource group.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the built-in Azure Policy definition: Audit resource location matches resource group location

tests.title: Monitor Blob Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Blob Storage Encryption monitoring is enabled
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits blob encryption in all storage accounts to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Storage Accounts from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for blob encryption.

tests.title: Monitor Endpoint Protection
tests.description: Ensures Endpoint Protection monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits the Endpoint Protection setting for all virtual machines for malware protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Endpoint Protection from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used to monitor missing Endpoint Protection.

tests.title: Log Profile Retention Policy
tests.description: Ensures that Log Profiles have a long retention policy.
tests.more_info: Log retention policies should be configured with sufficient retention to aid in investigation of prior security incidents and for compliance purposes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the Activity Log export to Event Hub is configured with a retention policy of at least 365 days.

tests.title: Security Policy Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for create or update Security Policy Rule events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update Security Policy Rule events gives insight into policy changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Security Policy Rule create or update events.

tests.title: Network Security Groups Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the create or update and delete Network Security Group events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Network Security Group events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Network Security Group create or update and delete events.
tests.remediation_description: A Network Security Group log alert will be created to monitor create, update and delete actions

tests.title: Security Solution Logging
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete Security Solution events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Security Solution events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Security Solution create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Monitor System Updates
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor System Updates is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will audit virtual machines for pending OS or system updates.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure System Update monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor JIT Network Access
tests.description: Ensures Just In Time Network Access monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits Just In Time Network Access on all virtual machines (Windows and Linux as well) to enhance data protection at rest
tests.recommended_action: Ensure JIT Network Access monitoring is configured for compute and apps from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Admin Security Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that security alerts are configured to be sent to admins
tests.more_info: Enabling security alerts to be sent to admins ensures that detected vulnerabilities and security issues are sent to the subscription admins for quick remediation.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that security alerts are configured to be sent to subscription owners.

tests.title: Security Contacts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that security contact phone number and email address are set
tests.more_info: Setting security contacts ensures that any security incidents detected by Azure are sent to a security team equipped to handle the incident.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that email notifications are configured for the subscription from the Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor NSG Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Security Groups monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will audit the Network Security Groups that are enabled on the VM for permissive rules.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Network Security Group monitoring is configured from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Network Watcher Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Watcher is enabled in all locations
tests.more_info: Network Watcher helps locate, diagnose, and gain insights into Azure networks. Enabling Network Watcher in all locations ensures that no resources are being used in locations that are not authorized.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the Network Watcher service in all locations.

tests.title: Excessive Security Groups
tests.description: Determines if there are an excessive number of security groups in the account
tests.more_info: Keeping the number of security groups to a minimum helps reduce the attack surface of an account. Rather than creating new groups with the same rules for each project, common rules should be grouped under the same security groups. For example, instead of adding port 22 from a known IP to every group, create a single "SSH" security group which can be used on multiple instances.
tests.recommended_action: Limit the number of security groups to prevent accidental authorizations.

tests.title: Advanced Data Security Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Advanced Data Security is enabled for SQL Servers
tests.more_info: Enabling Advanced Data Security on all SQL Servers ensures that SQL server data is encrypted and monitored for unusual activity, vulnerabilities, and threats.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Advanced Data Security is enabled for all SQL Servers.

tests.title: SQL Server Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Servers do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL Server instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VNET.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the firewall of each SQL Server is configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: DB Restorable
tests.description: Ensures SQL Database instances can be restored to a recent point
tests.more_info: Automated backups of SQL databases with recent restore points help ensure that database recovery operations can occur without significant data loss.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each SQL database has automated backups configured with a sufficient retention period and that the last known backup operation completes successfully.

tests.title: Auto Provisioning Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that automatic provisioning of the monitoring agent is enabled
tests.more_info: The Microsoft Monitoring Agent scans for various security-related configurations and events such as system updates, OS vulnerabilities, and endpoint protection and provides alerts.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the data collection settings of the subscription have Auto Provisioning set to enabled.

tests.recommended_action: Ensure that high severity alerts are configured to be sent.

tests.description: Ensures that standard pricing is enabled in the security center
tests.more_info: Enabling standard pricing increases the security posture of the subscription. This enables advanced security monitoring for the services covered under the security center.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that standard pricing is enabled in the security center.

tests.title: Open Salt
tests.description: Determine if TCP ports 4505 or 4506 for the Salt master are open to the public
tests.more_info: Active Salt vulnerabilities, CVE-2020-11651 and CVE-2020-11652 are exploiting Salt instances exposed to the internet. These ports should be closed immediately.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP ports 4505 and 4506 to known IP addresses
tests.remediation_description: The impacted network security group rule will be deleted if no input is provided. If the failing port is in a port range and no input is provided, the range will be deleted. Otherwise, any input will replace the open CIDR rule.

tests.title: Open Docker
tests.description: Determine if Docker port 2375 or 2376 is open to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as Docker should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP ports 2375 and 2376 to known IP addresses
tests.remediation_description: The impacted network security group rule will be deleted if no input is provided. If the failing port is in a port range and no input is provided, the range will be deleted. Otherwise, any input will replace the open CIDR rule.

data.name: Utilize Security Controls
data.description: Implement security controls relevant to your objectives, risk tolerance, and operational environment, including authentication, personnel security, configuration management, incident response, and accountability.

tests.title: Storage Accounts HTTPS
tests.description: Ensures HTTPS-only traffic is allowed to storage account endpoints
tests.more_info: Storage Accounts can contain sensitive information and should only be accessed over HTTPS. Enabling the HTTPS-only flag ensures that Azure does not allow HTTP traffic to Storage Accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the HTTPS-only option for all Storage Accounts.
tests.remediation_description: The HTTPS-only option will be enabled for the storage account

tests.title: Storage Accounts Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is enabled for Storage Accounts
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all Storage Accounts are configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: Blob Service Immutable
tests.description: Ensures data immutability is properly configured for blob services to protect critical data against deletion
tests.more_info: Immutable storage helps store data securely by protecting critical data against deletion.
tests.recommended_action: Enable a data immutability policy for all storage containers in the Azure storage account.

tests.title: VM OS Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that VM OS Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM OS disks (boot volume) ensures that the entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM OS Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: VM Data Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Data Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM Data Disks (non-boot volume) ensures that its entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM Data Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: VM Endpoint Protection
tests.description: Ensures that VM Endpoint Protection is enabled for all virtual machines
tests.more_info: Installing endpoint protection systems provides for real-time protection capabilities that help identify and remove viruses, spyware, and other malicious software, with configurable alerts for malicious or unwanted software.
tests.recommended_action: Install endpoint protection on all virtual machines.

tests.title: File Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures file shares do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: File shares can be configured to allow to read, write, or delete permissions from a share. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all file shares and ensure the share ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Table Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures tables do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Table Service tables can be configured to allow to read, write or delete on objects. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all tables and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Queue Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures queues do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Queues can be configured to allow object read, write or delete. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, delete policies on all queues and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Virtual Network Alerts Monitor
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete Virtual Networks events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Virtual Networks events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Virtual Networks create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Monitor Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Disk Encryption monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits disk encryption in all virtual machines to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Disk Encryption from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for virtual machines.

tests.title: Identity Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a system or user assigned managed identity is enabled to authenticate to App Services without storing credentials in the code.
tests.more_info: Maintaining cloud connection credentials in code is a security risk. Credentials should never appear on developer workstations and should not be checked into source control. Managed identities for Azure resources provides Azure services with a managed identity in Azure AD which can be used to authenticate to any service that supports Azure AD authentication, without having to include any credentials in code.
tests.recommended_action: Enable system or user-assigned identities for all App Services and avoid storing credentials in code.
tests.remediation_description: The web app will be assigned a system manager identity

tests.title: HTTPS Only Enabled
tests.description: Ensures HTTPS Only is enabled for App Services, redirecting all HTTP traffic to HTTPS
tests.more_info: Enabling HTTPS Only traffic will redirect all non-secure HTTP requests to HTTPS. HTTPS uses the SSL/TLS protocol to provide a secure connection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable HTTPS Only support SSL settings for all App Services
tests.remediation_description: The HTTPS-only option will be enabled for the web app

tests.title: Open SMTP

tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as SMTP should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 25 to known IP addresses
tests.remediation_description: The impacted network security group rule will be deleted if no input is provided. If the failing port is in a port range and no input is provided, the range will be deleted. Otherwise, any input will replace the open CIDR rule.

tests.title: Network Access Default Action
tests.description: Ensures that Storage Account access is restricted to trusted networks
tests.more_info: Storage Accounts should be configured to accept traffic only from trusted networks. By default, all networks are selected but can be changed when creating a new storage account or in the firewall settings.
tests.recommended_action: Configure the firewall of each Storage Account to allow access only from known virtual networks.
tests.remediation_description: Default network action will be set to deny all traffic for affected storage accounts

tests.title: Blob Container Private Access
tests.description: Ensures that all blob containers do not have anonymous public access set
tests.more_info: Blob containers set with public access enables anonymous users to read blobs within a publicly accessible container without authentication. All blob containers should have private access configured.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure each blob container is configured to restrict anonymous access
tests.remediation_description: Access level for affected blob containers will be set to private

tests.title: Authentication Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Authentication is enabled for App Services, redirecting unauthenticated users to the login page.
tests.more_info: Enabling authentication will redirect all unauthenticated requests to the login page. It also handles authentication of users with specific providers (Azure Active Directory, Facebook, Google, Microsoft Account, and Twitter).
tests.recommended_action: Enable App Service Authentication for all App Services.
tests.remediation_description: The App Service Authentication option will be enabled for the web app

tests.title: Application Whitelisting Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Security Center Monitor Adaptive Application Whitelisting is enabled
tests.more_info: Adaptive application controls work in conjunction with machine learning to analyze processes running in a VM and help control which applications can run, hardening the VM against malware.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Virtual Machines from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used.

tests.title: Detect Insecure Custom Origin
tests.description: Ensures that HTTPS is enabled for CDN endpoints with a custom origin
tests.more_info: All Azure CDN endpoints should enable HTTPS to secure traffic to the backend custom origin.
tests.recommended_action: Enable HTTPS and disable HTTP for each custom origin endpoint for each CDN profile.

tests.title: Default Security Group
tests.description: Ensures that default security groups block all traffic by default
tests.more_info: The default security group is often used for resources launched without a defined security group. For this reason, the default rules should be set to block all traffic to prevent an accidental exposure.
tests.recommended_action: Update the rules for the default security group to deny all traffic by default

tests.title: Monitor VM Vulnerability
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor Vulnerability Assessment is enabled in Security Center.
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for detected vulnerabilities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure VM Vulnerability monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Encryption is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor for unencrypted SQL databases, associated backups, and transaction log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL encryption monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Auditing
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Auditing is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor SQL databases.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL auditing monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Open All Ports
tests.description: Ensures Network Security Groups do not expose all ports to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, almost all services should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict ports to known IP addresses

tests.title: Log Storage Encryption
tests.description: Ensures BYOK encryption is properly configured in the Activity Log Storage Account
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the Storage Account used by Activity Logs is configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: Log Container Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that the Activity Log Container does not have public read access
tests.more_info: The container used to store Activity Log data should not be exposed publicly to avoid data exposure of sensitive activity logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the access level for the storage account containing Activity Log data is set to private.

tests.title: NSG Log Analytics Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Security Group logs are sent to the Log Analytics workspace
tests.more_info: Enabling Log Analytics for Network Security Groups ensures that logs are shipped to a central repository that can be queried and audited.
tests.recommended_action: Enable sending of logs to Log Analytics for each Network Security Group resource in the Azure Monitor.

tests.title: Log Profile Archive Data
tests.description: Ensures the Log Profile is configured to export all activities from the control and management planes in all active locations
tests.more_info: Exporting log activity for control plane activity allows for audited access to the Azure account with event data in the case of a security incident.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all activity is logged to the Event Hub or storage account for archiving.

tests.title: Security Configuration Monitoring
tests.description: Ensures that Security Configuration Monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for security configurations.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Security Configuration Monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Resource Location Matches Resource Group
tests.description: Ensures a policy is configured to audit that deployed resource locations match their resource group locations
tests.more_info: Using Azure Policy to monitor resource location compliance helps ensure that new resources are not launched into locations that do not match their resource group.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the built-in Azure Policy definition: Audit resource location matches resource group location

tests.title: TDE Protector Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQL Server TDE protector is encrypted with BYOK (Bring Your Own Key)
tests.more_info: Enabling BYOK in the TDE protector allows for greater control and transparency, as well as increasing security by having full control of the encryption keys.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that a BYOK key is set for the Transparent Data Encryption of each SQL Server.

tests.title: Monitor Blob Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Blob Storage Encryption monitoring is enabled
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits blob encryption in all storage accounts to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Storage Accounts from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for blob encryption.

tests.title: Monitor Endpoint Protection
tests.description: Ensures Endpoint Protection monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits the Endpoint Protection setting for all virtual machines for malware protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Endpoint Protection from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used to monitor missing Endpoint Protection.

tests.title: File Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures data encryption is enabled for File Services
tests.more_info: File Service encryption protects your data at rest. Azure Storage encrypts your data and automatically decrypts it for you as you access it.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that data encryption is enabled for each File Service.

tests.title: Blob Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is properly configured for Blob Services
tests.more_info: Blob Services can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt Blob Services, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Blob Service is configured to use a customer-provided key vault key.

tests.title: Trusted MS Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Trusted Microsoft Services Access is enabled on Storage Accounts
tests.more_info: Enabling firewall rules on Storage Accounts blocks all access by default. To ensure that Microsoft and Azure services that connect to the Storage Account still retain access, trusted Microsoft services should be allowed to access the storage account.
tests.recommended_action: For each Storage Account, configure an exception for trusted Microsoft services.

tests.title: Multiple Subnets
tests.description: Ensures that Virtual Networks have multiple networks to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: A single network within a Virtual Network increases the risk of a broader blast radius in the event of a compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Create multiple networks/subnets in each Virtual Network and change the architecture to take advantage of public and private tiers.

tests.title: Security Policy Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for create or update Security Policy Rule events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update Security Policy Rule events gives insight into policy changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Security Policy Rule create or update events.

tests.title: Network Security Groups Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the create or update and delete Network Security Group events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Network Security Group events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Network Security Group create or update and delete events.
tests.remediation_description: A Network Security Group log alert will be created to monitor create, update and delete actions

tests.title: Security Solution Logging
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete Security Solution events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Security Solution events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Security Solution create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Monitor System Updates
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor System Updates is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will audit virtual machines for pending OS or system updates.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure System Update monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor JIT Network Access
tests.description: Ensures Just In Time Network Access monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits Just In Time Network Access on all virtual machines (Windows and Linux as well) to enhance data protection at rest
tests.recommended_action: Ensure JIT Network Access monitoring is configured for compute and apps from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Admin Security Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that security alerts are configured to be sent to admins
tests.more_info: Enabling security alerts to be sent to admins ensures that detected vulnerabilities and security issues are sent to the subscription admins for quick remediation.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that security alerts are configured to be sent to subscription owners.

tests.title: Security Contacts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that security contact phone number and email address are set
tests.more_info: Setting security contacts ensures that any security incidents detected by Azure are sent to a security team equipped to handle the incident.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that email notifications are configured for the subscription from the Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor NSG Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Security Groups monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will audit the Network Security Groups that are enabled on the VM for permissive rules.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Network Security Group monitoring is configured from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Network Watcher Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Watcher is enabled in all locations
tests.more_info: Network Watcher helps locate, diagnose, and gain insights into Azure networks. Enabling Network Watcher in all locations ensures that no resources are being used in locations that are not authorized.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the Network Watcher service in all locations.

tests.title: Excessive Security Groups
tests.description: Determines if there are an excessive number of security groups in the account
tests.more_info: Keeping the number of security groups to a minimum helps reduce the attack surface of an account. Rather than creating new groups with the same rules for each project, common rules should be grouped under the same security groups. For example, instead of adding port 22 from a known IP to every group, create a single "SSH" security group which can be used on multiple instances.
tests.recommended_action: Limit the number of security groups to prevent accidental authorizations.

tests.title: Advanced Data Security Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Advanced Data Security is enabled for SQL Servers
tests.more_info: Enabling Advanced Data Security on all SQL Servers ensures that SQL server data is encrypted and monitored for unusual activity, vulnerabilities, and threats.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Advanced Data Security is enabled for all SQL Servers.

tests.title: SQL Server Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Servers do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL Server instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VNET.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the firewall of each SQL Server is configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

tests.title: TLS Version Check
tests.description: Ensures that all web apps are using the latest version of TLS
tests.more_info: App Services currently allows web apps to use TLS versions 1.0, 1.1 and 1.2. It is highly recommended to use the latest TLS 1.2 version for web app TLS connections.
tests.recommended_action: Set the minimum TLS version to 1.2 for all App Services.
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected Web Apps

tests.title: Database Auditing Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Database Auditing is enabled
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Database Auditing ensures that all database activities are being logged properly, including potential malicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that auditing is enabled for each SQL database.

tests.title: SQL DB Multiple AZ
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Database instances are created to be cross-AZ for high availability
tests.more_info: Creating SQL Database instances in a single availability zone creates a single point of failure for all systems relying on that database. All SQL Database instances should be created in multiple availability zones to ensure proper failover.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each SQL Database is configured to be zone redundant.

tests.title: DB Restorable
tests.description: Ensures SQL Database instances can be restored to a recent point
tests.more_info: Automated backups of SQL databases with recent restore points help ensure that database recovery operations can occur without significant data loss.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each SQL database has automated backups configured with a sufficient retention period and that the last known backup operation completes successfully.

tests.title: LB HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures load balancers are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports
tests.more_info: For maximum security, load balancers can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections will be blocked. This should only be done if the client application is configured to query HTTPS directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each load balancer only accepts connections on port 443.

tests.title: Key Vault Recovery Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Purge Protection and Soft Delete are enabled on all Key Vaults
tests.more_info: Purge Protection and Soft Delete are features that safeguard losing key access. With these setting enabled, key vaults have recovery actions available to restore deleted or compromised key vaults.
tests.recommended_action: Once Key Vaults are created, the Azure CLI must be used to update the vault Soft Delete and Purge Protection settings.

tests.title: Storage Accounts AAD Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that identity-based Directory Service for Azure File Authentication is enabled for all Azure Files
tests.more_info: Enabling identity-based Authentication ensures that only the authorized Active Directory members can access or connect to the file shares, enforcing granular access control.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that identity-based Directory Service for Azure File Authentication is enabled for all Azure File Shares.

tests.title: Auto Provisioning Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that automatic provisioning of the monitoring agent is enabled
tests.more_info: The Microsoft Monitoring Agent scans for various security-related configurations and events such as system updates, OS vulnerabilities, and endpoint protection and provides alerts.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the data collection settings of the subscription have Auto Provisioning set to enabled.

results.message: Unable to query auto provisioning settings: Please register to Microsoft.Security in order to view your security status

tests.title: Log Retention Period
tests.description: Ensures logs are configured to be retained for 4 or more days for PostgreSQL servers
tests.more_info: Having a long log retention policy ensures that all critical logs are stored for long enough to access and view in case of a security incident.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the server parameters for each PostgreSQL server have the log_retention_days setting set to 4 or more days.

tests.title: Open Oracle Auto Data Warehouse
tests.description: Determine if TCP port 1522 for Oracle Auto Data Warehouse is open to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as Oracle Auto Data Warehouse should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP ports 1522 to known IP addresses
tests.remediation_description: The impacted network security group rule will be deleted if no input is provided. If the failing port is in a port range and no input is provided, the range will be deleted. Otherwise, any input will replace the open CIDR rule.

tests.title: Audit Retention Policy
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Auditing retention policy is set to greater than 90 days
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Server Auditing ensures that all activities are being logged properly, including potentially-malicious activity. Having a long retention policy ensures that all logs are kept for auditing and legal purposes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the storage account retention policy for each SQL server is set to greater than 90 days.

tests.title: Audit Action Groups Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Audit Action and Groups is configured properly
tests.more_info: SQL Server Audit Action and Groups should be configured to at least include SUCCESSFUL_DATABASE_AUTHENTICATION_GROUP, FAILED_DATABASE_AUTHENTICATION_GROUP and BATCH_COMPLETED_GROUP.
tests.recommended_action: If SQL Server Audit Action and Groups is not configured properly when enabling Auditing, these settings must be configured in Powershell.

tests.title: Server Auditing Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Auditing is enabled for SQL servers
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Server Auditing ensures that all activities are being logged properly, including potentially-malicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that auditing is enabled for each SQL server.

tests.title: Password Requires Lowercase
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require lowercase characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Numbers
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require numbers
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Symbols
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require symbol characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Uppercase
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require uppercase characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Minimum Password Length
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require a minimum length
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including the minimum password length, defaulted to 8 characters.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Enforce MySQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connection is enforced on MySQL servers
tests.more_info: MySQL servers should be set to use SSL for data transmission to ensure all data is encrypted in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security of each Azure Database for MySQL is configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected MySQL servers

tests.title: Enforce PostgreSQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connections are enforced on PostgreSQL Servers
tests.more_info: SSL prevents infiltration attacks by encrypting the data stream between the server and application.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security settings of each PostgreSQL server are configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected PostreSQL servers

tests.title: Email Account Admins Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that email account admins is enabled in advanced data security for SQL servers.
tests.more_info: Enabling email account admins in advanced data security on all SQL servers ensures that monitored data for unusual activity, vulnerabilities, and threats get sent to the account admins and subscription owners.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that also send email notification to admins and subscription owners is enabled in advanced threat protections for all SQL servers.

tests.title: Send Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that send alerts is enabled in advanced data security for SQL servers.
tests.more_info: Enabling send alerts in advanced data security on all SQL servers ensures that monitored data for unusual activity, vulnerabilities, and threats get sent to the email addresses configured in advanced data protections.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that an email address is activated under send alerts in advanced data security for all SQL servers.

tests.title: Network Security Groups Rule Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the create or update and delete Network Security Group rule events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Network Security Group rule events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Network Security Group rule create or update and delete events.

tests.title: High Severity Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that high severity alerts are properly configured.
tests.more_info: Enabling high severity alerts ensures that microsoft alerts for potential security issues are sent and allows for quick mitigation of the associated risks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that high severity alerts are configured to be sent.

tests.title: Standard Pricing Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that standard pricing is enabled in the security center
tests.more_info: Enabling standard pricing increases the security posture of the subscription. This enables advanced security monitoring for the services covered under the security center.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that standard pricing is enabled in the security center.

tests.title: Open Salt
tests.description: Determine if TCP ports 4505 or 4506 for the Salt master are open to the public
tests.more_info: Active Salt vulnerabilities, CVE-2020-11651 and CVE-2020-11652 are exploiting Salt instances exposed to the internet. These ports should be closed immediately.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP ports 4505 and 4506 to known IP addresses
tests.remediation_description: The impacted network security group rule will be deleted if no input is provided. If the failing port is in a port range and no input is provided, the range will be deleted. Otherwise, any input will replace the open CIDR rule.

tests.title: Open Docker
tests.description: Determine if Docker port 2375 or 2376 is open to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as Docker should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP ports 2375 and 2376 to known IP addresses
tests.remediation_description: The impacted network security group rule will be deleted if no input is provided. If the failing port is in a port range and no input is provided, the range will be deleted. Otherwise, any input will replace the open CIDR rule.

data.name: Conduct Risk Assessments
data.description: Assess and validate your security controls to identify any potential gaps and weaknesses.

tests.title: Monitor VM Vulnerability
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor Vulnerability Assessment is enabled in Security Center.
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for detected vulnerabilities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure VM Vulnerability monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

data.name: Perform Continuous Monitoring
data.description: monitor the security controls and systems for modifications and changes. Types of monitoring you will need to incorporate include configuration management, file integrity monitoring, vulnerability scanning, and log analysis.

tests.title: SQL Server Firewall Rule Alerts Monitor
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete SQL Server Firewall Rules events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete SQL Server Firewall Rules events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for SQL Server Firewall Rules create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Virtual Network Alerts Monitor
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete Virtual Networks events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Virtual Networks events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Virtual Networks create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Monitor Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Disk Encryption monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits disk encryption in all virtual machines to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Disk Encryption from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for virtual machines.

tests.title: Authentication Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Authentication is enabled for App Services, redirecting unauthenticated users to the login page.
tests.more_info: Enabling authentication will redirect all unauthenticated requests to the login page. It also handles authentication of users with specific providers (Azure Active Directory, Facebook, Google, Microsoft Account, and Twitter).
tests.recommended_action: Enable App Service Authentication for all App Services.
tests.remediation_description: The App Service Authentication option will be enabled for the web app

tests.title: Application Whitelisting Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Security Center Monitor Adaptive Application Whitelisting is enabled
tests.more_info: Adaptive application controls work in conjunction with machine learning to analyze processes running in a VM and help control which applications can run, hardening the VM against malware.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Virtual Machines from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used.

tests.title: Monitor VM Vulnerability
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor Vulnerability Assessment is enabled in Security Center.
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for detected vulnerabilities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure VM Vulnerability monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Encryption is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor for unencrypted SQL databases, associated backups, and transaction log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL encryption monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Auditing
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Auditing is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor SQL databases.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL auditing monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Log Storage Encryption
tests.description: Ensures BYOK encryption is properly configured in the Activity Log Storage Account
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the Storage Account used by Activity Logs is configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: Log Container Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that the Activity Log Container does not have public read access
tests.more_info: The container used to store Activity Log data should not be exposed publicly to avoid data exposure of sensitive activity logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the access level for the storage account containing Activity Log data is set to private.

tests.title: NSG Log Analytics Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Security Group logs are sent to the Log Analytics workspace
tests.more_info: Enabling Log Analytics for Network Security Groups ensures that logs are shipped to a central repository that can be queried and audited.
tests.recommended_action: Enable sending of logs to Log Analytics for each Network Security Group resource in the Azure Monitor.

tests.title: Log Profile Archive Data
tests.description: Ensures the Log Profile is configured to export all activities from the control and management planes in all active locations
tests.more_info: Exporting log activity for control plane activity allows for audited access to the Azure account with event data in the case of a security incident.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all activity is logged to the Event Hub or storage account for archiving.

tests.title: Security Configuration Monitoring
tests.description: Ensures that Security Configuration Monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for security configurations.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Security Configuration Monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Resource Location Matches Resource Group
tests.description: Ensures a policy is configured to audit that deployed resource locations match their resource group locations
tests.more_info: Using Azure Policy to monitor resource location compliance helps ensure that new resources are not launched into locations that do not match their resource group.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the built-in Azure Policy definition: Audit resource location matches resource group location

tests.title: Monitor Blob Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Blob Storage Encryption monitoring is enabled
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits blob encryption in all storage accounts to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Storage Accounts from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for blob encryption.

tests.title: Monitor Endpoint Protection
tests.description: Ensures Endpoint Protection monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits the Endpoint Protection setting for all virtual machines for malware protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Endpoint Protection from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used to monitor missing Endpoint Protection.

tests.title: Endpoint Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that endpoint requests are being logged for CDN endpoints
tests.more_info: Endpoint Logging ensures that all requests to a CDN endpoint are logged.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that diagnostic logging is enabled for each CDN endpoint for each CDN profile

tests.title: Load Balancer Log Analytics Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Load Balancers Log Analytics logs are being properly delivered to Azure Monitor
tests.more_info: Enabling Send to Log Analytics ensures that all Load Balancer logs are being properly monitored and managed.
tests.recommended_action: Send all diagnostic logs for Load Balancers from the Azure Monitor service to Log Analytics.

tests.title: Key Vault Log Analytics Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Key Vault Log Analytics logs are being properly delivered to Azure Monitor
tests.more_info: Enabling Send to Log Analytics ensures that all Key Vault logs are being properly monitored and managed.
tests.recommended_action: Send all diagnostic logs for Key Vault from the Azure Monitor service to Log Analytics.

tests.title: Log Profile Retention Policy
tests.description: Ensures that Log Profiles have a long retention policy.
tests.more_info: Log retention policies should be configured with sufficient retention to aid in investigation of prior security incidents and for compliance purposes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the Activity Log export to Event Hub is configured with a retention policy of at least 365 days.

tests.title: Security Policy Alerts Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for create or update Security Policy Rule events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update Security Policy Rule events gives insight into policy changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Security Policy Rule create or update events.

tests.title: Network Security Groups Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log alerts for the create or update and delete Network Security Group events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Network Security Group events gives insight into network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Network Security Group create or update and delete events.
tests.remediation_description: A Network Security Group log alert will be created to monitor create, update and delete actions

tests.title: Security Solution Logging
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete Security Solution events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Security Solution events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Security Solution create or update and delete events.

tests.title: Monitor System Updates
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor System Updates is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will audit virtual machines for pending OS or system updates.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure System Update monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor JIT Network Access
tests.description: Ensures Just In Time Network Access monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits Just In Time Network Access on all virtual machines (Windows and Linux as well) to enhance data protection at rest
tests.recommended_action: Ensure JIT Network Access monitoring is configured for compute and apps from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Monitor NSG Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Security Groups monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will audit the Network Security Groups that are enabled on the VM for permissive rules.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Network Security Group monitoring is configured from the Azure Security Center.

tests.recommended_action: Ensure that auditing is enabled for each SQL database.
